intro: Chrysosplenium sphaerospermum var. vidalii, commonly known as the golden sphaerosperm, is a small, herbaceous perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe. It belongs to the Saxifragaceae family and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring, surrounded by glossy, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in rocky or forested areas. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation efforts.
